page.title: 04CHANGING TIMES
page.content: Mr Thorburn was born in 1915 and is 70 years old,and he went to school when he was 5.Direlton school used to have about 70 pupils.They were taught RE, History,Art,Geography,Maths and Music. If they wanted to go to High school they had to pass an exam.They only stayed at High School for 2 years. The bus service between Edinburgh and North Berwick started in 1926. There were 3 shops in the village and a blacksmith,joiner and plumber. The church was built in 1633.The poor were given 2/6d(12p)by the parish. There were no street lamps and the pavements were made of gravel and grit :the kerb was made of rough stones.The roads were made of gravel and were very narrow. The station was built in 1892 and went out of use in 1963.
